_header: Prick of Conscience this book is I-hote
_description: Epilogue to The Pricke of Conscience — in couplets and triplets

Lichfield50.First Lines:
Prikke of conscience þis bok is i hoteþe qweche ys
                    underestondyng ofoure þe bote…
Lichfield50.Last Lines:
…In þo ȝeris in þe qweche we feyin mechil
                    illeffor we havvvyn þo nout at oure wisse

BodEngPoeta1.Transcription:
Prikke of conciens hette þis bookHose wole mai rede and
                    look
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BLAdd22283.Transcription:
Prikke of conciens hette þis bookWhoso wol mai rede &
                    lookExplicit
BLAdd22283.Note:
Variant. These are the concluding lines of 423, which is followed by the prose
                    ‘Þe meditacion of Ihesu cristes fyue woundus’, preceding the
                        Pricke (5398).
BLAdd22283.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library MS Add. 22283 (‘Simeon’).
         2014; http://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Add_MS_22283.
